# Next.js Skill

> Full-stack React framework for {{category}} projects

## When to Use

Use this skill for routing, API routes, SSR/SSG, and Next.js-specific patterns.

## Key Concepts

| Concept | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| App Router | File-based routing | Pages in app/ directory |
| Server Components | Server-rendered by default | Data fetching, SEO |
| Route Handlers | API endpoints | app/api/*/route.ts |
| Metadata | SEO configuration | Page titles, descriptions |

## Patterns for {{category}}

```tsx
// Server Component with data fetching
async function Page({ params }: { params: { id: string } }) {
  const data = await fetchData(params.id);
  return <div>{data.title}</div>;
}

// Route Handler (API)
// app/api/items/route.ts
export async function GET() {
  const items = await db.items.findMany();
  return Response.json(items);
}

export async function POST(request: Request) {
  const body = await request.json();
  const item = await db.items.create({ data: body });
  return Response.json(item, { status: 201 });
}

// Metadata
export const metadata = {
  title: 'Page Title',
  description: 'Page description',
};
```

## File Structure

```
app/
├── layout.tsx      # Root layout
├── page.tsx        # Home page
├── loading.tsx     # Loading UI
├── error.tsx       # Error UI
├── api/
│   └── route.ts    # API routes
└── [slug]/
    └── page.tsx    # Dynamic routes
```

## Pitfalls

- Don't use client hooks in Server Components
- Add 'use client' directive for client components
- Use `next/image` for optimized images
- Handle loading and error states
